title: Kara3
author: Kara3
content: _ Stick to Bitcoin: it's the real deal. Don't gamble on other cryptos_ Avoid trading altcoin: you are not a genius trader, you will eventually get burned._ Never trust price prediction: no one has a crystal ball._ DCA into Bitcoin, emotions aside, No need to time this market._ share Bitcoin cautiously, people might think you want to scam them._ Attend meet up and conference, the Bitcoin community is awesome._ Guide newcomers to the crypto industry to Bitcoin only._join #bitcoin Twitter: it's less lonely with fellow holders._ Don't Force Bitcoin on others, but be a resource to those who seek knowledge

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Kara3 on October 05, 2023, 03:54:06 AM_ Attend meet up and conference, the Bitcoin community is awesome.Though this is not necessarily bad, just be cautious that it could be a security and privacy nightmare. Probably wear a facemask and a cap, and don't go straight home after the conference/meetup, instead, go to a very public place like a mall first. Just to be sure as to prevent people from following you.https://chainsec.io/wrench-attack

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Well, at least this post seems to be based on your real experience, and not on a probably made-up story, as we so often see in this section, and the advice you give is pretty good in my opinion. Attending conferences and guiding newcomers I wouldn't do it for privacy, and I don't have a twitter account, but the rest are fine. The only thing is that they will be useful for those who are just starting out, not for those of us who have been on the forum for years. Quote from: mk4 on October 05, 2023, 03:59:58 AMThough this is not necessarily bad, just be cautious that it could be a security and privacy nightmare. Probably wear a facemask and a cap, and don't go straight home after the conference/meetup, instead, go to a very public place like a mall first. Just to be sure as to prevent people from following you.Or just don't go.

comments.body: Bitcoin twitter has been awful lately. Sorry to admit it but it got worse after Elon took over. comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Kara3 on October 05, 2023, 03:54:06 AM_ Never trust price prediction: no one has a crystal ball.Bitcoin investors put their money in the currency not because they can predict the price but because they trust the coin. When I see these so-called bitcoin analysts come up with different speculations as if they know the future, I just overlook them and abide by my plans. Quote_ share Bitcoin cautiously, people might think you want to scam them.People might also want to scam or even steal from you because they will assume you are rich. In my country, people immediately think you are wealthy if you tell them you own bitcoin.  Quote_ Guide newcomers to the crypto industry to Bitcoin only._join #bitcoin Twitter: it's less lonely with fellow holders._ Don't Force Bitcoin on others, but be a resource to those who seek knowledge You can also introduce newcomers to bitcointalk instead of any other platform. At least we are sure that he would get a vast level of knowledge. Also, encourage newcomers to do their own research.

comments.author: legendbtc
comments.body: Quote from: adaseb on October 05, 2023, 04:00:16 AMBitcoin twitter has been awful lately. Sorry to admit it but it got worse after Elon took over. Basically you got nothing but bots posting phishing websites and scams.Doesn’t matter what you are trying to search for? Whether bitcoin, Ethereum, alts, defi you will get nothing but massive replies about scams which try and steal your bitcoins. If you are only interested in bitcoin and don't want to invest in altcoins or new projects, don't go anywhere else but bitcointalk. Here you will find everything about bitcoin that you cannot find anywhere else. Twitter is my favorite place to read daily news but since Elon introduced a policy of writing content to make money, things started to become a mess. People repeat the same content over and over again just to attract more followers for a higher chance of receiving rewards from Elon. There's no denying that it was a pretty good business strategy for Elon to attract more users to Twitter, but it also made things worse in terms of content.

comments.author: Kakmakr
comments.body: Yes, Bitcoin is King.... but people should also experiment with other Alt coins to gain experience of the whole Crypto currency scene. How can you appreciate Bitcoin, if you cannot compare it with something else? There are a huge world out there, with countless opportunities to learn more about this wonderful technology and we should use it to the best of our abilities to improve the world around us.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: Kara3 on October 05, 2023, 03:54:06 AM_ Attend meet up and conference, the Bitcoin community is awesome.You can attend Bitcoin meetups and conferences if you want to join the crowd but my warning for you is simple.When you join meetups or conferences, don't bring a device (like PC, laptop, smartphone) that you store biggest part of your capital. You can bring a device on which you store small part of your capital, consider it is your hot wallet that you afford to lose it.Attending those events that are surely crowded, will bring risk to lose your devices and even you afford to lose your devices, you have to protect your capital that should be kept at home, not bringing around the street and events.

comments.author: traderethereum
comments.body: You have gained knowledge about Bitcoin based on your experience and what you said is true.But other people may get other knowledge besides what you convey and their experience will be different from what you get.For investing, bitcoin is the best but for trading, altcoins might be an option but to start trading, one should have analytical skills to find the right coin.By having analytical skills, we will not choose the wrong coins so we can make a profit.And be careful if you want to attend meetings or conferences because not all of them discuss bitcoin but they only discuss projects that they want to release and have nothing to do with bitcoin.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: Kara3 on October 05, 2023, 03:54:06 AM_ Avoid trading altcoin: you are not a genius trader, you will eventually get burned.Only if you are an absolute beginner otherwise altcoins were created to be traded, that's their whole purpose Quote_ Attend meet up and conference, the Bitcoin community is awesome.I'm not a big fan of such conferences on a topic such as Bitcoin, they're mostly a waste of time. You can always find the information online and in a much shorter time without needing to attend a hours long conference.Quote_join #bitcoin Twitter: it's less lonely with fellow holders.I'm not a fan of this either. comments.author: Ben Barubal
comments.body: Quote from: Kara3 on October 05, 2023, 03:54:06 AM_ Stick to Bitcoin: it's the real deal. Don't gamble on other cryptos_ Avoid trading altcoin: you are not a genius trader, you will eventually get burned._ Never trust price prediction: no one has a crystal ball._ DCA into Bitcoin, emotions aside, No need to time this market._ share Bitcoin cautiously, people might think you want to scam them._ Attend meet up and conference, the Bitcoin community is awesome._ Guide newcomers to the crypto industry to Bitcoin only._join #bitcoin Twitter: it's less lonely with fellow holders._ Don't Force Bitcoin on others, but be a resource to those who seek knowledge     There's nothing wrong with sticking to Bitcoin, and it's good to hold a lot of it if you buy a lot. But it's not right to say don't trade altcoins. Why are altcoins bad? You should clarify why you don't trade altcoins. What is that? Are you saying this in general, or are you referring to altcoins that are not good to trade?   Be clear first: when you trade altcoins, you won't make money? Are bitcoins and altcoins non-volatile? How can you learn to trade if you avoid trading in altcoins? Do you think you can only learn to trade with Bitcoin? Having a lot of experience does not mean that our knowledge is extensive and that what we say is correct. That is not the case.

comments.author: fuguebtc
comments.body: Quote from: Kakmakr on October 05, 2023, 05:35:57 AMYes, Bitcoin is King.... but people should also experiment with other Alt coins to gain experience of the whole Crypto currency scene. How can you appreciate Bitcoin, if you cannot compare it with something else? There are a huge world out there, with countless opportunities to learn more about this wonderful technology and we should use it to the best of our abilities to improve the world around us.  I also invested a small amount in altcoins and realized that I was gambling rather than investing, there wasn't anything to learn in gambling. There is only win or lose and it depends entirely on luck. You are not wrong in saying that people should try altcoins to see the superiority of bitcoin over shitcoins but many people have tried it and got addicted. Because they are blinded by advertisements about altcoins that can bring tons of profits, and until they lose everything, they suddenly wake up. So it's better not to try.
